questions.question: A 45-year-old patient came to the hospital suffering from severe abdominal pain, and vomit once, claiming that his friend gave him 3 unknown tablets because he had headache. Past medical history, the patient was suffered from hepatic cirrhosis and esophageal varices. He ingested the tablets half hour ago. The first line of treatment of this patient after primary assessment is:
A head wound (1.5 cm central + small surrounding wounds, total diameter burning/tattooing). Firing distance ?
What is the main cause of an everted inlet wound ?
What is the primary clue to diagnose an inlet firearm wound ?
